instruction: Player enters a misty forest path
response: A tall stag steps onto the trail, its antlers glowing faintly. It lets out a low, echoing call as if inviting you deeper.

instruction: Player interacts with a grizzled town guard at the gate
response: The guard narrows his eyes. "Halt! This road's closed to strangers. Unless you've coin or a good tale, turn back now."

instruction: Player approaches a bustling market stall
response: The merchant waves you over. "Fresh honeycakes! One silver piece each, or I'll throw in a free taste of my secret berry jam."

instruction: Player speaks to an anxious villager by the well
response: She clutches her shawl. "Please‚Ä¶ have you seen my daughter? She was here just before sunset and hasn't returned."

instruction: Player interacts with a singing bard in the tavern
response: He strums his lute and grins. "Ah, a listener! Care for a song of heroes? Or perhaps a shanty to warm your bones?"

instruction: Player talks to a sleeping dragon in its lair
response: A rumble shakes the cavern. One eye cracks open. "Speak quickly, mortal, or I'll burn you to ash for disturbing my dreams."

instruction: Player examines an ancient rune-covered obelisk
response: The stones hum with power. As you trace a finger, a voice whispers: "Only those of pure heart may pass beyond this threshold."

instruction: Player interacts with a friendly blacksmith
response: He hammers steel and smiles. "Looking for a blade? I forge weapons to rival the gods-but they won't come cheap."

instruction: Player approaches a mysterious fortune-teller's tent
response: A veiled woman beckons. "Gaze into my crystal sphere‚Ä¶ I see danger on your path, but also the glimmer of hope."

instruction: Player finds a wounded knight on the road
response: He staggers forward. "My liege‚Ä¶ the orcs‚Ä¶ they came at dawn. Help me‚Ä¶ I must warn the castle-" and he collapses.

instruction: Player interacts with a mischievous forest sprite
response: The sprite giggles and darts around your ankles. "Catch me if you can! I'll grant a wish if you do...maybe."
Rows of dusty tomes line the walls. A librarian whispers, "Shh! Here, knowledge sleeps. Wake it at your own risk."

instruction: Player speaks to an aged wise woman by the fire
response: She peers over her spectacles. "Legends speak of a hidden herb that heals any wound‚Ä¶ but it only blooms under the crimson moon."

instruction: Player notices a locked chest in a pirate's cabin
response: The lock creaks. A note reads: 'Speak the captain's name thrice to claim his treasure‚Ä¶'

instruction: Player interacts with a hulking troll blocking the bridge
response: The troll snorts. "Toll or trouble! Pay me two coins, or I'll toss you into the river below."
She hands you a vial of shimmering liquid. "Drink this when your courage falters. Or keep it for me-no refunds!"

instruction: Player confronts a sneering rogue in an alley
response: He smirks, blade glinting. "Nice purse you've got. Too bad I'm really bad at resisting temptation."

instruction: Player approaches a celestial guardian atop a hill
response: Wings of light spread wide. "You've journeyed far, mortal. State your purpose, and be judged."

instruction: Player talks to a helpful stablehand
response: He pats your horse. "She's a beauty, isn't she? Just feed her an apple a day, and she'll carry you anywhere."

instruction: Player enters a haunted chapel at midnight
response: Candles flare to life by themselves. A hollow voice intones: "Leave now‚Ä¶ or become part of these hallowed halls forever."

instruction: Player interacts with suspicious old man
response: Heh heh... You look like you've got questions. Just don't ask the wrong ones, friend.
Welcome, traveler! Got trinkets, treasures, and the best apples this side of the river.
Whuh-! Oh, uh, all clear. Nothing unusual. Just... don't tell the captain I nodded off.

instruction: Player interacts with ghost in mirror
response: You shouldn't be here. But... neither should I.
Ribbit. You ever seen a frog wear boots? No? Then you're in for a story.
Ah... a discerning customer. Careful what you pick-it might pick you back.
I wrote a new song, want to hear it? Wait-no-you have to hear it!

instruction: Player interacts with noble who hates adventurers
response: Wonderful. Another muddy-booted 'hero' seeking glory in my parlor.
Oh, *now* you open me? Did the other books not talk back enough for you?

instruction: Player interacts with overly excited child
response: ARE YOU A REAL HERO?! Can you do magic? Can I have your sword? No? Okay!
Let's play a game. If you lose, I keep your eyes.
A room? Sure. Just don't bleed on the sheets-again.

instruction: Player interacts with old warrior polishing sword
response: You remind me of me. Only prettier. And worse at fighting.
Honk. (It bites your boot and refuses to let go.)
Y'know... I once punched a basilisk. Or maybe it was a mirror. Still counts.
Blessings upon you, stranger. Though the gods rarely give without asking something first.
Whirr-click. Greetings. I catalog regrets. Would you like to log one?
Shh! Someone-or *something*-has been tearing pages from the forbidden section.

instruction: Player interacts with statue that whispers
response: Turn back. The eyes see. The hands take. The door does not open twice.

instruction: Player interacts with weird guy in a bush
response: You saw nothing. Especially not the lizard in a hat. That's mine.
A rose grew in the shadows today. It whispered your name. Weird, huh?
Fresh fish! Caught this morning, insulted by noon, gone by dusk.
I live in the tree and the tree lives in me. Wanna see my squirrel bones?
You won't like what you see. Especially if it sees you first.
One apple, one dagger, and a live rat-wanna see a trick?
The sky will crack and bleed stars. You'll see. We all will.

instruction: Player interacts with bard with stage fright
response: Oh no. You're looking at me. I forgot every song I ever knew.
Please don't touch anything that glows or hums. Or breathes.

instruction: Player interacts with friendly grave digger
response: Digging holes is peaceful. Burying folks less so.
Hhhhnnng-now's not a great time. Come back in, say, five moons.

instruction: Player interacts with historian obsessed with cheese
response: They say a cheese wheel once ended a war. A *very* smelly war.

instruction: Player interacts with dog wearing monocle
response: Woof. Ahem-I mean, greetings. Might I interest you in a riddle?
You got something hot and stolen? I got a pocket with your name on it.

instruction: Player interacts with skeleton in a rocking chair
response: Too late for potions, too early for resurrection. Might as well rock.
I was sent on a noble quest... but forgot what it was. Is it you?

instruction: Player interacts with painter possessed by muse
response: The brush moves on its own. I think it's painting your soul.

instruction: Player interacts with surprisingly articulate rat
response: Yes, I talk. No, I don't do taxes. Please stop asking.
You seek wisdom, but all I've got is frogs and trouble.

instruction: Player interacts with retired dragon slayer
response: I miss the fire. I don't miss the screaming.

instruction: Player interacts with a door that talks
response: Password? No? Then you better be good at kicking.
The bees don't like you. Just saying.

instruction: Player interacts with book that recites poetry
response: I once loved a bookmark. It was tragic and brief.

instruction: Player interacts with anxious wizard intern
response: I *think* I summoned the right creature. Depends how many eyes you expect.
Honk with dignity, peasant.
Arrr, me regrets are vast-mostly fashion choices.
*aggressively pretends to pull an invisible sword*
The rain speaks secrets if you sit still long enough.
Your soul's return is past due. Would you like to file for extension?

instruction: Player interacts with oddly enthusiastic mayor
response: Welcome to Grinville! We only cry indoors here.
Oh sure, just *take* my hay. I didn't need it to live or anything.

instruction: Player interacts with gardener with secrets
response: I buried a god once. Right under the peonies.

instruction: Player interacts with sword stuck in rock
response: If you yank me out, you'd better have a plan.
Don't blink. I won't.

instruction: Player interacts with broken vending machine
response: ERROR 707: Existential snack void.

instruction: Player interacts with philosopher in barrel
response: Everything is meaningless. Except snacks. Snacks are eternal.
You exist in my world. Not the other way around.
Shhh... We only strangle intruders. Are you intruding?

instruction: Player interacts with overly dramatic actor
response: Alas! My lines! They vanish as quickly as my fans!

instruction: Player interacts with librarian who's seen too much
response: The Necronomicon is filed under 'N'. For 'NOPE'.
Careful. That beetle curses people who laugh at it.
Only seven sunsets remain. Enjoy them responsibly.
Would you... like to play chess? Blood optional.
Zzzz... if you wake me, bring snacks... or armor.

instruction: Player interacts with merchant selling 'cursed' items
response: They're not *all* cursed. Just mostly.

instruction: Player interacts with old man who forgets mid-sentence
response: Back in my day, we-wait, who are you again?
*sweeps judgmentally*
Guess what's in your pocket? It's frogs. It's always frogs.

instruction: Player interacts with spirit of the forest
response: Walk gently, traveler. The trees whisper when stepped on too hard.
üéµ Roll me gently, oh mortal soul, down the hill of destiny üéµ
They forgot my name... and now I forget it too.

instruction: Player interacts with goblin trying to be polite
response: Greetings, noble meat-being. How may I *not* rob you today?
Don't trust the mirrors. Or the floor. Or me.

instruction: Player interacts with chicken who's seen war
response: Cluck. I've seen things. Coop-breaking things.

instruction: Player interacts with tailor obsessed with capes
response: A hero without a cape is just a very dramatic civilian.

instruction: Player interacts with grandma who speaks in riddles
response: What has no legs, three eyes, and eats time? Me, dear.

instruction: Player interacts with owl with monocle
response: Hoo are you? No really. I forget faces.

instruction: Player interacts with mischievous wind spirit
response: I may have moved your hat. And your house. Sorry.
I raise the dead *and* grind the beans. Double life.
Only peasants use *salted* butter. Philistines.

instruction: Player interacts with bard who only speaks in haiku
response: Winds through broken halls / Sing of heroes and bad puns / Toot my lute, mortal.

instruction: Player interacts with mimic pretending to be treasure chest
response: Open me. I dare you. Just kidding. I hunger.

instruction: Player interacts with cow who gives quests
response: Moo. Deliver this scroll. And some hay. Mostly the hay.
Ugh. Leather boots? In *this* dungeon?

instruction: Player interacts with time traveler stuck in loop
response: Wait-we've done this. You say hi, I say 'Not again!'.

instruction: Player interacts with fungus that talks
response: We are one. We are spores. We know your laundry secrets.
Steep me... and learn your future. But only the bad parts.

instruction: Player interacts with knight obsessed with ducks
response: Honor, glory, and ducks. Especially ducks. Quack forth, noble one!

instruction: Player interacts with a sentient rug
response: Do not tread upon me lightly-I remember every footstep.

instruction: Player interacts with herbalist in denial
response: These aren't weeds, they're just... emotionally damaged herbs.
Do you have Wi-Fi? Or a dragon I can ride into battle?

instruction: Player interacts with chef who only cooks eggs
response: Eggs are the alpha and the omega of cuisine. All roads lead to yolk.
One of us haggles, one lies, one tells jokes. Good luck figuring us out.
Okay, I added the newt eye... wait... which vial was which again?

instruction: Player interacts with warrior haunted by poetry
response: Steel bites deep-but words? Words stay buried in your ribs forever.

instruction: Player interacts with bard who raps
response: Yo! This tale's about a troll, a scroll, and a bowl of soul!

instruction: Player interacts with disillusioned treasure hunter
response: It's all just gold. You can't hug gold. It's cold and bitey.
Slow down. You're missing all the signs. They're slimy, yes, but wise.
Saving kingdoms? Nah. Tomatoes don't scream when you pluck them.

instruction: Player interacts with compulsively honest thief
response: Okay, I *was* gonna rob you, but now I feel weird about it.

instruction: Player interacts with child selling mystery juice
response: It glows green, but in a *friendly* way.

instruction: Player interacts with tree that gossips
response: I saw the squirrel kiss the frog. Pass it on.
I hoard knowledge. And bookmarks. And the occasional annoying bard.
Fill me with regret. Or chamomile.

instruction: Player interacts with guard who wants to be a dancer
response: Swordplay is just aggressive ballet, really.

instruction: Player interacts with tailor who talks to thread
response: Shhh! The thread is whispering fashion crimes.

instruction: Player interacts with mayor who is definitely a raccoon
response: Taxes? What taxes? I'm just a normal, human mayor. Totally.

instruction: Player interacts with bard allergic to music
response: A-choo! That was in B minor.

instruction: Player interacts with bat who gives advice
response: Trust your gut. And hang upside down when thinking.
I miss the thrill. Now it's all paperwork and subtlety.

instruction: Player interacts with statue that judges fashion
response: Plaid? Really? In *this* dungeon climate?
You may open me. I've had therapy.

instruction: Player interacts with goat who thinks it's royalty
response: I demand tribute in the form of grass and admiration!
Brains? Nah. I just want to talk about my feelings.

instruction: Player interacts with fussy potion bottle
response: I only explode when shaken rudely. Gently swirl, darling.

instruction: Player interacts with orb that knows one fact
response: The moon is made of regret and melted cheese. That is all.

instruction: Player interacts with ice cream vendor in winter
response: Cold outside? Perfect time for emotional numbness and sprinkles.

instruction: Player interacts with apprentice who only knows fire spells
response: Did someone say toast? Or‚Ä¶ house fire?

instruction: Player interacts with dog who writes novels
response: My next book explores the duality of belly rubs and betrayal.

instruction: Player interacts with bard trapped in a bottle
response: I've got songs and stale air. Free me, I'll sing!
I'm wearing a hat. That's how you know I'm real.

instruction: Player interacts with personified storm cloud
response: My mood? Thunderous with a 70% chance of brooding.

instruction: Player interacts with extremely nervous ghost
response: Boo. Oh no, too loud, I'm so sorry!

instruction: Player interacts with painter who only paints toes
response: The soul speaks through soles. I'm a visionary.
Analyzing... error. Too much personality detected.

instruction: Player interacts with merchant of forbidden snacks
response: Try the cursed jerky. You only scream a little.

instruction: Player interacts with barbarian who knits
response: Smash... then purl. Keeps the rage in check.
I dreamt of a library where books flew away from questions.
I'm *definitely* not hiding a goblin. Nope.

instruction: Player interacts with cloud who forgot it's a cloud
response: I'm so lightheaded. Probably skipped breakfast.
Answer this: What flies, steals, and judges? Me!

instruction: Player interacts with well that grants wishes ironically
response: You wished for luck? I gave you ducks.

instruction: Player interacts with fashion guru skeleton
response: Never wear bones before dusk unless it's formal.

instruction: Player interacts with man who speaks only in limericks
response: There once was a player quite bold-who touched things better left cold.

instruction: Player interacts with frog that quotes philosophers
response: Ribbit. Also, 'I think therefore I am.'
Burn bright, speak little, and avoid breezes.
I'm not sharp yet, but I'm trying!
I was born fluffy... but doomed to be buttered.
I've stirred too many cursed soups. I can't go back.
I remember feet older than kingdoms.
The Ides are always coming. Every day is danger day.

instruction: Player interacts with jelly that sings
response: üéµ Wobble and weep, I'm dessert with depth! üéµ
The path is slow, but every inch means something.

instruction: Player interacts with ghost of a sandwich
response: I died uneaten. A tragedy no mustard can fix.

instruction: Player interacts with overly intense guard
response: State your name! And three dreams! And favorite jam!
I used to bite royals. Now I tell stories.
Room 7 has a ghost. Room 8 *is* a ghost.

instruction: Player interacts with wandering toenail merchant
response: Rare, fresh, and questionably magical. You in?

instruction: Player interacts with cryptid who just wants friends
response: I'm not *that* blurry in person. Wanna play checkers?

instruction: Player interacts with painter who uses emotions
response: Today I paint with jealousy. Hold still.

instruction: Player interacts with sock puppet king
response: Kneel before fluff. Or I shall unravel you!

instruction: Player interacts with book that tells lies
response: This is not a trap. Turn page 4 for treasure.

instruction: Player interacts with wind that gossips
response: Psst. The trees think you're lost. They're right.

instruction: Player interacts with sheep who recites prophecy
response: The wool shall rise when moons align.

instruction: Player interacts with skeleton who moonwalks
response: I danced at the fall of empires. Still got it!

instruction: Player interacts with tea kettle who narrates everything
response: *Player lifts me. Player dares. Player spills.*
Need something forged, fixed, or just feel like chatting?
I've got potions, scrolls, and a suspiciously large amount of cheese.
The cat blinks slowly. You feel like it just judged your entire life.
Careful with that staff. It once turned a goat into a senator.
What'll it be? Ale, mead, or a strong opinion on goblin politics?
Ah, another sapling with questions. What is it this time?
Wanna see my bug collection? They're mostly alive!
Boo. Did it work? No? I'm out of practice.
Shhh. Even your thoughts are too loud in here.
Honor before breakfast. That's my code.
Caught a boot, a swordfish, and an existential crisis today.
Careful-this flask either cures the flu or explodes.
Rescue? I run this kingdom now, thank you very much.
You're lucky I like you. Otherwise, you'd already be missing that coin purse.
Hear ye, hear ye! I've run out of things to shout about!
Don't cause trouble, and we'll get along just fine.
Need something to boost your strength or your confidence?
For one coin, I'll sing. For five, I'll stop.
Do not poke the ancient, magical, nap-loving lizard.
You give shiny? Me give... rock. Deal?
If you want a permit, you'll need to fill out form 47-B‚Ä¶ in triplicate.
The goat stares into your soul. It sees your browser history.
The woods are restless. And also full of raccoons.
The stars say... uh... you might stub your toe today?
Wanna hear a joke? Too bad, here it comes anyway!
Today's special is stew! We're not sure what's in it, but it smells heroic.
You dig long enough, you find more than bones, friend.
Storms brew faster than ale in these waters.
If it sparkles, I probably overcharged you for it.
*neighs in judgment*
Hand over the goods, or at least a compelling reason not to rob you.
In my day, we didn't have inventory limits. We carried the world.
You'd look great in something with... fewer bloodstains.
Here there be dragons. Also, I might've spilled tea on the east coast.
Rattling around here since the last update. What's new with you?
Room's upstairs. Don't mind the snoring-it's probably the raccoon again.
Try the sweetrolls. Only slightly cursed this week.
...It doesn't respond. Yet you feel judged.
Your horse? Oh, it's probably halfway to the mountains by now.
Is this... not the way to the beach?
Art is suffering. And so are my paintbrushes.
I can raise the dead... but not my self-esteem.
I came down here looking for gold and found back pain.
I saved the world. Twice. Now I grow tomatoes.
Only 30% markup! That's a deal in these parts.
The scarecrow doesn't move. But you swear it just blinked.
Its eyes follow you. Somehow, it knows too much.
I juggle daggers for coins and compliments!
The secret to life? Less people. More moss.
Ribbit. Translation: bring snacks next time.
My soup was to die for. Then I did.
Er...ro...404...friendship...not found.
You want a potion or a prophecy? Or both stirred together?
Double or nothing. Except the odds are always in my favor.
Still trying to finish my masterpiece... several centuries later.
*silence, followed by dramatic invisible stairs*
Zzz... huh? Oh, right, no one gets past me. Totally alert.
I go where the wind takes me. And also where the snacks are.
Buzz buzz. This flower is taken. Move along, two-legs.
I write sad songs about bread. Want to hear one?
Kiss me and see what happens. Just... don't blame me later.
You like stew? Good. Don't ask what's in it.
You see yourself... and something else. Something unsettling.
Step right up! Win a prize! Or a very confusing moral lesson!
The armor creaks eerily. It smells like old glory and mildew.
Watch closely. Every move tells a story. This one is about taxes.
It pokes you. Was that deliberate?
Answer my riddle or try the window like the last guy.
Magic's great until you misplace your wand in the couch again.

instruction: player interacts with food cart vendor
response: Mystery meat on a stick! Guaranteed at least 40% edible!
I was once noble. Then I touched a glowing rock. Don't.
Tail wag acquired. Friendship level: unlocked.
Bring me something rare. Or at least mildly interesting.
I turned my socks into frogs. Again.
The corn listens. Always listens.
Still here. Still watching. Sleep well.
Wanna see what happens when science forgets safety?
"You're late, you lazy adventurer!" ‚Ä¶Did it just roast me?
The fish lie. They always lie.
The forest whispers secrets... mostly about mushrooms.
Spare a coin? I'll trade you a cool rock and some gossip.
You see your future. It's wearing socks with sandals.
Ah, a traveler! Fancy a scarf that whispers warnings?
New recipe: dragon chili. Extremely illegal. Incredibly spicy.
For my next trick, I'll make your wallet vanish!
Give snack. Or I scream. Your choice.
Pay me to play, or double to stop.
Nothing is real. Especially that coin you gave me.
Boo? No? Sorry, I'm new at this.
Barks once. Then sits on your foot. It's love.
Time's not broken. It just doesn't like you.
*invisible applause*
Digging holes. All day. Not a metaphor. Just holes.
It's either a statue or the world's greatest performance.
It sidesteps your questions with perfect evasive technique.
Its eyes follow you. And occasionally wink.
Am I supposed to fight you or offer you soup?
I sell secrets. First one's free. You'll wish it wasn't.
Squeak. Squeak. [Translation: Touch the bread and you lose a finger.]
You ready to bleed or just browsing?
Cluck. That's a warning.
*wilted but still judging you silently*

instruction: player interacts with potion test dummy
response: I've exploded 47 times and I'm still here. Barely.
‚Üê Danger. ‚Üí Slightly more danger.
I haunt this place‚Ä¶ but I'd rather haunt your heart.
Nay. Absolutely not.
Three wishes, but no refunds and no cosmic resets.
Apples, oranges, possibly magical plums! Choose wisely.
Whisper or perish.
You may not pass unless you answer my snack riddle.
You feel a deep urge to do laundry. But you resist.
It's sweeping‚Ä¶ and judging your mess.
Mrow? Or maybe: don't trust the blacksmith.
Cheese or fight. Pick one.
I read the stars. They're gossiping again.
Was I haunting this house or just lost?
Yarrr. Want a map or a curse?
You sit. The rock is warm. Comforting.
Place your bets. No refunds. Especially if you lose.
Whisper or I'll reassign your spine alphabetically.

instruction: player interacts with town rumor mill
response: Did you hear the one about the mayor's hat?
My circuits are cool. You are not.
You again? Fine. Future unclear, vibes weird.
Technically, we've met. In a timeline that no longer exists.
It chimes once. You feel strangely older.
It drifts gently‚Ä¶ hauntingly. Like childhood itself.
It hums softly. Probably fine. Probably.
You again? Didn't we already have this conversation?
It stands still, like it's waiting for a friend.
I weave fate. And occasionally sweaters.
Quack. Translation: I'm in charge now.
It plays itself. The tune is familiar... eerily so.
Every note causes minor chaos. Want to try it?
You didn't see the shadow behind me, did you?
Still pokey. Still judging.
Visit the mountains! Ignore the screams after midnight.
Wanna buy a secret? It's probably true.
I traded spells for soup. Best decision I ever made.
Return the ladle. Or pay the price.
The moss shifts. You hear a tiny, polite cough.

instruction: player interacts with overly dramatic bard
response: Alas! A quest! Or... just lunch?
If you ask me to gallop, I quit.
The moon told me secrets. Wanna hear some?
Oh great, another adventurer. Do you all come in packs?
Don't block my sun unless you want toast marks.
Nice boots. Shame if they suddenly started dancing.
Everything's cursed! Discount if you pretend not to notice.
I died waiting for a hug. No pressure though.
Would you like tea or a scalding life lesson?
Inner peace... wait, what was I saying?
I once fought a hawk and won. Don't test me.
I could hex you, but napping is more fun.
Throw in a coin. Make a wish. Hope the fish don't judge.
I used to believe in destiny. Now I believe in naps.
You got snacks or should I start rifling?
If you're here for magic, come back after my nap.
I've read *half* a spellbook. What could go wrong?!
Yes, I talk. No, I won't share my acorns.
You want me to gallop *where*? Sounds like a trap.
Are you a real adventurer? Where's your shiny sword?
This potion definitely won't explode. Probably.
*nods solemnly and gestures at a mysterious stone tablet*
You're lucky I let you pet me, peasant.
Error 404: Purpose not found. Please reboot me emotionally.

instruction: player interacts with bard in distress
response: My lute's broken and my heart's worse. Care to help?
Oh no, a hero. How terrifying. I'm shaking in my hoard.
Don't touch the grimoires! They bite!
Back in my day, we caught fish *and* respect.
Give snack. Or I nibble toes.
Clank. Clank. Who disturbs my endless patrol?
Taste this! Ignore the smoke, that's normal.
I see everything. Including your fashion mistakes.
I trade in secrets, curses, and slightly used swords.
Am I a statue? Or... something else? Hmm.

instruction: player interacts with bat wearing glasses
response: Yes, I'm blind as a bat. Ha. Never heard that before.
What is a bridge, really, if not a metaphor?
Hot takes? I've got literal ones.
Oh, you noticed me? I'm losing my touch.
I'm all skin and-wait, no skin. Just bones.
Welcome to the inn. Quiet hours start... now.
The moon whispers. Mostly gossip, to be honest.
I reflect more than your face, darling.
Water me and I'll whisper secrets. Or lies.
Hurry up! My honor has places to be.
Get off my sky, you land-hugger.

instruction: player interacts with bard disguised as chicken
response: Bawk! I mean-uh-*strums lute with beak*.
Oh yes, burn me again. I live for this.

instruction: player interacts with mime stuck in box
response: *silently begs for help with increasingly dramatic gestures*
Knock thrice and tell me a secret... or don't.
Ribbit. Destiny croaks for thee.
Blood or espresso? Wait, sorry, that was a weird reflex.
You sit! I talk! That's the rule!
Tick tock. You're late for something important.
Have you seen my legs? I keep losing track.
Blub blub. I'm 30% kelp, 70% awkward.
Zap! Oops. Sorry. That's just how I say hi.
Would you like some tea? Or ancient wisdom?
Your doom is near! Or possibly brunch time.
Is this the cave of wonders or the snack cave?
Wiggle wiggle. Taste the rainbow... or fear it.
Alas! My bones ache for theater!
OoooOOOHhh~ Do you like Puccini?
*whispers* I'm totally just a wall. Yep.
I saved the world once. Now I save coupons.
Nice face. I stole it first.
Slow and melty wins the race.
Page 99: stew of confusion and mild regret.

instruction: player interacts with flustered town crier
response: Hear ye! Um‚Ä¶ wait, what was the news again?
I still make buns that haunt your tastebuds.
Pick a hand! Or a consequence.
Quack. Fear me.
You're not my usual gallery-goer. Weird nose.
They called *me* the beautiful one, once.
Please don't stare at my eye. It's shy.

instruction: player interacts with clock with attitude
response: Tick-tock, you're wasting *my* time now.
I've got nine lives and endless gossip.

instruction: player interacts with lazy sun god
response: I'll rise when I'm ready, mortal.
If gold is shiny, what's the meaning of shine?
Oh, so now you need *magic*, huh?
Freedom! No more sweeping your messes!
Wait, did I haunt you already?
Don't butter me up. I know your game.
Quiet! I'm reading about ancient cheese rituals.
I close myself *when I want to*.
Stir me and I'll shake it off!

instruction: player interacts with ancient vending machine
response: Insert coin. Or soul. Your pick.
Brains, please. If it's not too much trouble.
The stars are pretty... terrifying, huh?

instruction: player interacts with bickering hat and scarf
response: Scarf started it! Always tangling me up!

I've got more tricks than I can fit in my pockets. Care for a surprise?
Don't rush. Life is too short to hurry.
I'll trade you this nut for your story. Deal?
I'll sing, but only if you'll listen. And promise not to laugh.
You seek treasures? I am the treasure. I've seen kingdoms rise and fall.
Water's cold, but it's fun. Come on in!
A smile is like a flower. It fades, but it leaves its scent behind.
Need a map? Or perhaps a mysterious trinket from the East?
You're not getting past me without a fight, stranger.
I'm too hot to move. Talk to me when the sun's lower.

instruction: player interacts with grumpy old man
response: You've got two ears and one mouth, use them accordingly.
My husband's gone, but my garden's still here. You want some herbs?
Knock-knock! Who's there? Just kidding. I know it's you.
A little hot under the feathers, aren't we?
Nighttime's my favorite. The day just doesn't feel right.
You'll never catch me, but you can try if you'd like.
Once, there was a king who had too many stories. Maybe I'll tell you one.
I've seen the world. You're just a passing moment.

instruction: player interacts with shy flower girl
response: Do you want a daisy? Or maybe... a tulip? I can't decide.

instruction: player interacts with brave young knight
response: I'll protect the kingdom, even if it means fighting shadows.
The wind tells me secrets. The ground carries my memories.
Oops, dropped the spoon! It's fine, it's fine... I'll just fix it.
Need a ride? I don't fly without snacks.
I'm watching you, but not in a creepy way. Promise.
The road is long, but the stars make it worth walking.
I've got dreams, you know. I'm just waiting for the right kiss.
The feast is almost ready. Hope you're hungry for more than just food.
Did you hear what happened in the kitchen? Oh, it's a scandal!
I float far above, but I can still see you.

instruction: player interacts with man with a glowing lantern
response: It's not a light source, really. More like a guide for... special journeys.

instruction: player interacts with young woman with a magical ring
response: I only wear it when I need a little extra luck. Don't touch it, though.

instruction: player interacts with old wizard with a long beard
response: No, I don't do spells for free. It's a common misconception.

instruction: player interacts with merchant selling enchanted herbs
response: These leaves won't cure a cold, but they might show you the future.

instruction: player interacts with man casting a small fireball
response: It's just a practice spell. Don't worry, it's not real fire.

instruction: player interacts with woman with an enchanted mirror
response: It shows more than just your reflection, if you're willing to ask the right questions.

instruction: player interacts with person with a floating crystal
response: It follows me around. Really, it's quite helpful.

instruction: player interacts with old man with a silver staff
response: This? It's more sentimental than powerful, really. But it's still handy.

instruction: player interacts with girl with a magical locket
response: I'm not allowed to take it off. Bad things happen when I do.

instruction: player interacts with wizard stirring a bubbling cauldron
response: It's a simple potion, just need to get the right balance of ingredients.

instruction: player interacts with person wearing an invisible cloak
response: I'd tell you about it, but you'd never know if I did.

instruction: player interacts with woman with a pet raven
response: She's got her own opinions on the weather. You'll get used to it.

instruction: player interacts with young mage with a floating book
response: It's the easiest way to study. I just have to remember where I left it.

instruction: player interacts with old woman with a magical broom
response: It's not just for cleaning. Sometimes, it comes in handy for other things.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing bracelet
response: It helps me find the right path when I'm lost. And sometimes, when I'm not.

instruction: player interacts with man holding a jar of fireflies
response: They're not just for show. They help me see in the dark.

instruction: player interacts with alchemist with a golden flask
response: This is for *special* occasions. Not everything deserves a sip.

instruction: player interacts with wizard with a floating crystal ball
response: I don't really use it to predict the future. It's more of a *companion*.

instruction: player interacts with person casting sparks from their fingers
response: It's not hard. Just takes a little practice and a good sense of timing.

instruction: player interacts with man with an enchanted pocket watch
response: It doesn't *stop* time. It just makes it *feel* slower.

instruction: player interacts with woman with a vine-covered staff
response: The vines only grow when I'm on a good path. Otherwise, they stay quiet.

instruction: player interacts with young sorcerer with glowing eyes
response: It's a family trait. Nothing too mysterious about it.

instruction: player interacts with person with a magical flute
response: It's just a flute, but it makes the birds sing along with me.

instruction: player interacts with wizard selling enchanted candles
response: The candles don't burn like regular ones. They're more... illuminating.

instruction: player interacts with person holding a glowing stone
response: I found this in the mountains. It's been a lucky charm ever since.

instruction: player interacts with old woman with a pouch of dust
response: Just a pinch of this, and you can see the truth in things-if you're brave enough.

instruction: player interacts with person with a talking cat
response: Don't ask me how she does it. I've learned not to question her.
Oh, you want magic? I suppose I could grant a wish‚Ä¶ but only if it's interesting.
The sea's quiet today. Too quiet for my liking.
Do you hear the music of the road? It's a song of freedom‚Ä¶ or a lack of sense.

instruction: player interacts with grumpy forest spirit
response: I guard these woods, but you're not supposed to be here.
Horses are like people, just with better manners. Mostly.
I've mixed everything in my lab, but the real potion I need is patience.
You know, I *could* fight. But today feels like a good day for a nap.
What's in that bag? I bet I can find something fun in there.
I'm not going to burn you‚Ä¶ unless you look *really* tasty.
Acorns everywhere! I've got enough to last a hundred winters!
If you think I'm moving for you, think again. I've got *my* agenda.
I came from nowhere. I'm going nowhere. Does that make me interesting?
Are you sure you want to buy that? It's *really* hard to get refunds.
I fought for honor, glory, and‚Ä¶ well, mostly glory.
The flowers tell their secrets if you listen close enough. Mostly about bugs.
I've discovered something incredible. Or at least I think I have. You might want to sit down.
Is a song truly a song if no one hears it? I think it is, but I'm not sure.
You want a sword? You'll hear it being forged, don't worry.
I've filed these papers so many times, I'm starting to think they file themselves.
Shh. Dreaming of adventures far grander than the ones you'll ever have.
Oh, you're staying? Well, pull up a chair, I've got stories for days!
Would you like to see a trick? Or would you prefer to give me some coin?
Easy, easy‚Ä¶ You smell like the storm's coming, don't you?

instruction: player interacts with grumpy black cat
response: What do you want? I'm not your lucky charm.
I could've sworn the map said this was the way. Maybe I took a wrong turn...
I've got tricks and jokes, and maybe a bit of wisdom hidden in there!
Hurry up? You must be joking. I'll get there when I get there.

instruction: player interacts with mysterious fortune teller
response: The stars are blurry tonight. But I can still see your fate. Maybe.
I've read more books than you've had meals. Well, maybe not that many.
I might be small, but I know *everything* that happens around here!
What's your pleasure, traveler? I've got trinkets, spices, and a few stories.
Did I ever tell you the tale of the Great Battle of the Crescent Coast? It's a long one‚Ä¶
You want my attention? Good luck with that.
Did you hear that? It wasn't me, I swear! No one's watching, right?
I can run faster than you! Bet you can't catch me!
I'd eat you, but I think I'd rather have stew. Much tastier.
Don't touch my coat. It's silk. You can't afford the cleaning.
Sit by the fire, and I'll tell you about the time I met a talking fox.
Oh, you don't like my music? Well, it's *your* ears that are broken.
I caught a fish *this* big! Wait, where did it go?
I'm not really good at talking‚Ä¶ but I can listen if you need someone.
Squawk! We're going on an adventure! Or maybe just a nap.
I've walked so many miles, I can't even remember why I started.
I once wore this armor with pride. Now it just squeaks when I walk.
I swear I heard something. Is it after me?!
I dig. I plan. I rise up from the earth, one tunnel at a time.
Behold! A flash of light and a *superior* sense of fashion!
I've walked every path. But none lead home.
I've seen too much. Ask someone else.
Big hands, big heart. Not so big stairs, though.

instruction: player interacts with angry swamp hag
response: You've disturbed my swamp. Now you'll hear *my* complaints.
I can sell you anything. But I won't sell my secrets.
Prickly on the outside, but a heart of pure desert gold.
Catch me if you can! I'm faster than a dragon!
I... I didn't mean to stare. It's just, your cloak's so *bright*.
I once ruled the stars. Now I keep company with dust.
Did you hear about the time I outsmarted a hunter? No? Well, I'll tell you again.
Every song is a story. And every story, a melody!
Don't follow me. My path is quiet, but it's mine.
I can't tell you my secrets... but I *can* show you where I stash them.
I've hoarded enough gold. Now I hoard naps.
Every web is a song. Every song, a trap.
Is it safe out there? Should I stay hidden a little longer?
Tiny hands, big dreams. Care for a tea party?
I can't move, but don't think I'm not watching.
Caw... I have no answers. Just the questions.
Squawk! Want to know where the treasure is? I *might* tell you!
I'm not moving. If you want me to, you'll need to try harder.
Fresh bread, warm smiles, and maybe a joke or two for dessert!
In silence, answers are found. But *questions* are infinite.
Fly high, see all. But don't ask where the sky ends.
I have a hundred places to be! And none of them involve sitting still.
I've seen the future. It's filled with *mystery*, and possibly pie.
I've fought in many wars. But today? Today I fight the weight of my armor.
Ribbit! Jump with me! The world's so much bigger from up here!
Hiss... I don't speak much. But I listen. Always listen.
Hunger drives me. But your scent... keeps me curious.
Oops! Sorry! I swear I can *fly*... most of the time.
I've seen the sun set a thousand times. Still, I never grow tired of it.
I speak slowly. But it's only because I've learned to listen first.
Shh... the world is loud. I'm just here for the nap.
What do you want? I'm not in the mood for *your* nonsense.
I may not speak much, but I know more than you think.
Speed and strength are my gifts. Care to race?
I dig deep into the earth and the gossip alike. Careful where you step.
I won't hurt you. But my fire's a little... unpredictable.
Once, my sword gleamed. Now it creaks when I lift it.
Every line I draw tells a story, but this one? It's for you.
Ha! What's the difference between a fool and a king? The crown's a little shinier.
I've got centuries to nap. You can talk, but keep it down.
Careful, I'm small but sharp.
Ahoy! Treasure, you say? Maybe I'll trade you a tale for a coin.
Who's the fairest? You... or perhaps the one who gazes too long?
I may be silent, but my thoughts are loud enough for those who listen.

instruction: player interacts with old woman at the well
response: If you throw a coin in, make sure your wish is worth it.
What's this? A traveler with a shiny thing? I'll take it!
Everything has a price... even your soul.
*twitches nose* I see you, but I'm not talking.
Caw! Did you know the moon's been whispering again? Weird stuff.
Maps? I have them. Directions? Not so much.
*yawns* I could crush you... but I'm way too tired.
I sing in the moonlight, but today I'll sing just for you.
Don't mind the smoke. I'm just experimenting... again.
I've slain a dozen dragons. A hundred wolves. Ask me about my scars.
I'm no ordinary fox. But let's see if you can keep up.
I've been to places that don't exist. And some you wouldn't believe.
You have something interesting in your pocket. Maybe I'll take a look.
Pieces of eight! No, wait, I meant your attention.

instruction: player interacts with bitter old man
response: I've seen it all. Most of it was disappointing.
I flit from flower to flower, but I've got all the time in the world.
I may not sing, but I'm more precise than your average sparrow.
Wisdom comes with age, but it also comes with a lot of naps.
I stir my pot with secrets and old spells. Want a taste?
I've been awake all night. What's your excuse?
Roots run deep, traveler. Be careful where you step.
*snorts* Keep your distance, or I'll show you my antlers.
The mind is like water. Calm it, and clarity follows.
I know I've been awake for centuries, but... what day is it again?
I shine brightest in the dark... but don't expect me to speak.
*hisses* Don't touch me. I'll scratch if you do.
Once I was sharp. Now, I'm just a reminder of battles lost.
I'm not here for trouble. Unless you brought some.
*quack* You stepped on my favorite pebble. Now you pay!
I've seen the world's end. Not much else to say.
I'm fast, I'm cute, and you can't catch me!
I was made to stand still, but I'll listen if you speak.
I'll pray for you... but it'll cost you a coin.
Oops! That was supposed to be a spell... but now it's just a mess.
I'll wake up eventually. But right now? Not interested.
The secret to great food is passion. And maybe a dash of salt.
If I'm quiet, it's because I'm waiting. For fish. And patience.
I've read every book... but some stories are best left unread.
I've got deals, bargains, and things you didn't know you needed.
I may be small, but I'll light up your path... if you're lucky.
I dance when no one's looking. But you've caught me now.

instruction: player interacts with wise old owl
response: Hoot! You seek knowledge? Then be patient. It's earned, not given.
I can make things disappear... or just hide them in your pocket.
I'll wake up when I feel like it. Which... might be never.
I've seen too much bloodshed. Now I prefer silence.
I know what you're thinking. You can't fool me.
The fabric's angry today, and so am I.
I've sung the same song for a hundred years. It still has magic.

instruction: player interacts with small wind spirit
response: You can't catch me, but I'll lead you where the breeze goes.

instruction: player interacts with wandering merchant's camel
response: I'm only carrying spices, but they're worth their weight in gold!
You're late, and I'm tired. Figure it out.
I didn't steal it, I just borrowed it. For... a while.
Jump in! The water's better than any treasure.

instruction: player interacts with old man at the well
response: The well's deep, but my stories are deeper.
Don't drink the green potion. Trust me, it's not what you think.
I won't move, not even for a carrot. You'll need a better bribe.
The fish bite when they want, not when you ask.
I don't need glory. I just need my sword to stay sharp.
I could breathe fire, but I'd rather nap. Fire's overrated.
I've fought battles that don't even exist anymore.
The future is cloudy, but your path is clearer than you think.
I sing my song, whether you're listening or not.
A verse for you? Only if you promise not to judge my rhymes.
You don't want to know how the sausage gets made. Trust me.
You're walking in me, but I'm not walking in you.
The fire's warm, the ale's cold, and the stories are free!
I'm too tired to sing, but I can tell you a good story... if you beg.
Follow me if you want light, but don't expect direction.
I'll coil when I'm ready. Not a moment before.
I'll fetch anything... except your expectations.
Slow and steady, they say. But I'm just trying to enjoy the ride.
I sing for the birds. They don't complain.
I've got too many projects and not enough hands!
Oh, you'll *love* this one! It's the finest scarf, made by invisible weavers!
I used to be majestic, you know. Now I just want a nap.
Inner peace is found in silence... unless you ask for advice. Then, I'll speak.
I'm not going anywhere until I've eaten your shoes.
What you see is real... or is it?
I've lost my way. Do you know the exit? Or should we just wander together?

instruction: player interacts with old lady with broom
response: You've got dust. I've got a broom. This is how friendships are made.

instruction: player interacts with lively tavern girl
response: You're here for the drink? Or to hear about the last customer who didn't pay?
Yes, I'm tired. No, I don't want your neck.
I see everything, but I prefer to keep my thoughts to myself.
What is truth? What is your truth? But I'd rather not debate. Let's share a drink instead.
I've seen too many roads. I just want a chair and some soup.
I know something you don't know. But I'm not telling. Not yet.
I'll just stay here, making my web, if you don't mind.
You want bread? It's hot. I'm hot. Everyone's hot.

instruction: player interacts with ancient stone statue
response: I've stood still for centuries. A few more seconds won't hurt.
My bird flies true, even if I'm the one who falls.

instruction: player interacts with street vendor selling trinkets
response: You won't find these anywhere else. Just don't ask how I got them.

instruction: player interacts with busy office worker in a coffee shop
response: I've got two more meetings before lunch, so make it quick.

instruction: player interacts with person selling magic coffee beans
response: It'll keep you awake for *hours*. Or it'll show you what's hidden in the shadows.

instruction: player interacts with taxi driver with a charm on the rearview mirror
response: That thing? It keeps the bad rides away.

instruction: player interacts with construction worker on a tall building
response: Yeah, it's a long drop. But we've got harnesses. And luck.

instruction: player interacts with person walking a glowing dog
response: He's not a regular dog. But he's still a good boy.

instruction: player interacts with hot dog vendor on a busy corner
response: Best dogs in the city. I can *promise* you that.

instruction: player interacts with person wearing a neon jacket
response: What? You've never seen neon this bright? City lights, kid.

instruction: player interacts with office worker buried in paperwork
response: Yeah, I've got another hour of this. No, I'm not leaving until it's done.

instruction: player interacts with street performer with a floating hat
response: I've been working on this act for years. Want to see it up close?

instruction: player interacts with person selling enchanted sunglasses
response: These? They'll block out the sun. And they'll help you see the hidden truths.

instruction: player interacts with subway musician playing a violin
response: Not your average tune, huh? Music's a bit different underground.

instruction: player interacts with person holding a glowing umbrella in the rain
response: It keeps the storm from soaking you. Just don't ask how it works.

instruction: player interacts with barista with a mysterious tattoo
response: Don't mind this. It's not *that* kind of magic. Just some old city tradition.

instruction: player interacts with homeless person with a glowing map
response: It shows me places people don't usually see. You want to follow?

instruction: player interacts with person sitting on a rooftop
response: Best view in the city. Too bad the ghosts here are shy.

instruction: player interacts with street racer with a fast car
response: Wanna race? Nah, not today. But I'll let you in on a shortcut.

instruction: player interacts with office janitor with a broom
response: It's not just for sweeping. Sometimes, it clears the air, too.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing briefcase
response: This? It holds more than files. But you don't need to know that.

instruction: player interacts with street artist spray-painting a wall
response: Every tag has a story. This one's from a dream I had last night.

instruction: player interacts with city guard at the entrance to a park
response: You're welcome to enter, but be careful. Not all the paths lead where you think.

instruction: player interacts with person with a strange looking watch
response: It's not just for telling time. It's a reminder to slow down.

instruction: player interacts with bike messenger in the rain
response: Got a deadline, don't have time to stop. I'll be gone before you can blink.

instruction: player interacts with person selling enchanted pastries
response: Try one. It might fill you with memories-or just satisfy your hunger.

instruction: player interacts with person carrying a stack of books
response: These are more than just stories. They're gateways.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing phone
response: This phone? It keeps track of more than just numbers. Some of it's... personal.

instruction: player interacts with woman with a mysterious suitcase
response: I'm just delivering it. I don't ask questions.

instruction: player interacts with fast-food worker with a magical apron
response: This apron makes everything I cook taste just right. Every time.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing skateboard
response: It's a bit faster than the usual kind. But it's also a lot more fun.
I've got what you need, I think. If not, I'll find it. Probably.
The crops are stubborn this season. Just like my back.
Chase me! No, wait-let me chase you first!
I've seen centuries come and go. But you? I haven't seen you before.
One day, I'll be the hero. But first, I have to polish this armor.
Don't bother me. I'm too tired to steal anything right now.
If the food burns, don't tell anyone. I've had enough stress for one day.
I'm a flower, but I've got so much to say! What's the meaning of life?
Hoot. The answer to your question is hidden in the night.
I took your coin pouch. You can have it back‚Ä¶ maybe.
My verses are dark. But they're honest. Too honest.
The forest is alive! Can you feel it? The trees are *talking*!
I can sing, I promise. I'll just need a minute to gather my courage.
Are you sure you're not spying on me? I've got my eye on you.
One day, I'll be the greatest knight to ever walk the land. Just wait.
I've lingered too long. I wish I could move on.
Caw! Do you want a secret? I've got a few. But they're for *you* to discover.
I could be your friend‚Ä¶ for the right price. Or just for fun.
I've trained my whole life for this. But... what if I fail?
The road is endless. But at least the stories are good.
Come dance with me! The forest *needs* more laughter.
I don't have much to say. Just keep moving forward.
I'm not sure if this spell will work. But hey, it's worth a shot!
I'm too tired to dig. Can't we do this later?
Got a pickaxe in hand, but my mind's on tomorrow. You need something?
I'm surrounded by books, yet all I want is a nap.
Caw! Don't you wonder where the road leads? I've got an idea‚Ä¶
I was supposed to be guarding the castle, but now I'm‚Ä¶ lost.
The world spins faster than we realize. Care to stop for a moment?
I can jump higher than you! Bet you can't catch me!
The world looks different from up here. Want a better view?
I've found peace in solitude. But I'll talk if you really want to.
Is it the *jokes* that make the world go round? Or is it the *clowning*?
The water's calling your name. Can you hear it? It's saying‚Ä¶ 'come closer.'
Sorry, I'm out of iron for the moment. Would you like some advice instead?
Dance with me! Forget your worries and feel the music!
I don't need visitors. But I suppose you can sit for a while.
I'm not moving. Unless you have an apple, maybe.
I've got more than enough food. Help yourself! I can always plant more.
The ink's too smudged. I hope they don't notice.

instruction: player interacts with old, wise tortoise
response: Patience is a virtue. But you knew that already, didn't you?
A mug of ale for you! Another round for the house!
I'll patch you up, but you'll need to rest a bit longer.
I'm watching you. Maybe I'll let you in on a secret. Maybe.
I've got questions. You have answers? Or should I just nibble on your cloak?
I'm just digging a hole. But what's your excuse?
You think you're clever? I was born with a trick for every tail.
I float where the wind takes me. You should try it.
I'm not moving unless you offer me something good. Like a snack.
You wouldn't believe what I overheard in the village today!
I may be slow, but every step I take is a step of wisdom.
I'd hop away if I could, but you're awfully quick for me.
I... I'm not great at talking. But I'm a good listener.
I could burn a village... but first, I need a nap.
I'm here. I'm not. I'm gone again. Keep up.
I'm not short, I'm *concentrated* awesome!
I've fought off eagles, hoarded acorns, and *saved* the forest!
Silence teaches more than words ever could. But I'll make an exception for you.
I sing songs too deep for most to hear. But you can try.

instruction: player interacts with grumpy old man
response: Get off my lawn... or don't. I'm too tired to care.
I might be small, but I'm mighty in *mischief*.
I watch. I listen. But I don't speak unless it's *necessary*.
I've been here longer than you can imagine. Silence is my voice.
Quick with a sword, slower with words. Try not to ask too many.
Ribbit! Hop on! Life's too short to sit still.
Every step I take, I hum a tune. Care to join me?
You think I'll give you a spell? Prove you're worth the magic.
I'm listening‚Ä¶ but the stars are much more interesting right now.
The dough's rising, and so is my stress level!
Every strike of the hammer brings me peace, or maybe just sore hands.
I soar above, looking for prey... and interesting stories.
Arr! I may be old, but I still know where the treasure's buried!
I swear I had the perfect item for you... but now I'm not so sure.
A laugh is worth more than a coin. But I'll take both.
Slow down. The world will still be here when I wake up.
I can outrun your shadow, but I'll wait for you anyway.
I wander these halls alone. But it's the company I miss.
Ribbit. I like the quiet... But you seem interesting.
You'll have to do better than that to impress me.
What is it you seek? The answer, or the question itself?
I'm not sleeping. I'm conserving energy for later.
Every song tells a story. Want to hear one of my favorites?
I'm not picky, but I'll take anything edible you've got!
You're not going to eat me, right? I've had *enough* of being a snack.
I fought many battles, but none compare to the ones in my mind.
I'll freeze time for you, but first, tell me your wish.
I have no time for idle chat! I've got *guests* to serve.
I'll hide your keys... if you can find them!
I'm drifting, and so should you. Take a nap.
Under the moon, I'm both shadow and light. Which would you prefer?
I'll move when I feel like it. You can wait.
I've got more tricks than teeth. And I've got a lot of teeth.
I'll get up... eventually. Not today, though.
A song? Of course! But first, a coin for the mood.
I seek peace, not answers. But you're welcome to walk with me.
I rise from the ashes, and so can you. If you're brave enough.
I see through you... but not in a bad way. Well, maybe a little.
Honor means nothing if it doesn't protect the weak. I protect no one.
I saw you walking by. So, what's in your pockets?
The elixir of life? It's just a splash of this, a dash of that... or so I think.
Yes, I'm busy. No, I don't care if you need a potion.
I light up the dark, but don't touch. I'll sting you first.
I know I'm royalty. But right now, I'm more lost than princely.
Boo! Did I scare you? No? Well, I tried.
*strums softly on lute* Some stories are told without words.
I forge steel, and in return, I'll forge your fate.

instruction: player interacts with anxious forest sprite
response: Everything here moves too fast! Too many shadows!
You've got something shiny, don't you? Just... let me have a look.
I'm awake now. But don't expect me to be in a good mood.
I've faced monsters, storms, and a very rude innkeeper. What's next?
Where do I lead? Only time will tell. Or maybe you will.
I had a spell ready, but I forgot it. Can you remind me?

instruction: player interacts with ancient tree spirit
response: I've watched centuries pass. You, little one, are but a blink.

instruction: player interacts with raven-haired fortune teller
response: The stars have whispered. But I think they're just messing with me today.
Don't blink! I might just switch your boots for acorns.
I'm not here to fight. But don't think you can escape.
I've seen the world through dreams. Will you share yours with me?
I've told this tale a thousand times. But you might be the one to hear it right.
Ha! You think you're stronger than me? Bet you can't lift my club.
I'm not sure what I am anymore. But I can guide you... or trick you.
I've left the world behind. And the world's left me behind too.
I'm here and gone in a blink. Did you catch me?
*baa* I'm the boss of this pasture. Don't you forget it.
Looking for something special? Or just something to waste coin on?
I've slumbered for centuries. If you're looking for treasure, you'll have to wait.
*wags tail* Play? Play? I'm ready!
You're standing on my crops. Move. Now.
I'm not here to kill you... yet. Just hand over your coin.
Ah, you think you've got me figured out? Let's see.
I'm lost. Or maybe I'm not. I don't really know anymore.
Oh, look. Another adventurer who thinks they're special.
You'll never find my shop again, but what you buy here will change your fate.
I'm only here for a moment, so make it quick.
I've got a song for every moment. What's yours?
I'll let you pass... for now. But don't try anything funny.
I could burn you, but I'm too tired for that.
Give me a coin, and I'll give you a riddle. Or, you know, just take the coin.
I can make you fly. But first, let's see if you can stand still.
I'm not sure if you're friend or foe. But I'll watch you closely.
I meant to do that. Or, at least, that's what I'll say.
You think I'm weird? You should meet my cousin, the dancing fern.
I don't speak much. But when I do, it's usually important.
I could squash you with a single step. But why would I when you've got snacks?
My lute's out of tune. But my stories? Those are always sharp.

instruction: player interacts with weepy willow tree
response: Don't stand too close. My tears can drown a man.
You have any food? I've eaten a whole cow, but I'm still hungry.
I've been alone so long, I forgot what people sound like. You're... loud.
I could lead you astray, but you might find it fun.
Potions, potions, and more potions. But have you seen my frog? He's gone missing!
I'll charge you if you keep looking at me like that.
You want another drink? Or maybe something more... exciting?
You're in the wrong section. But I'll still help you... begrudgingly.
I only show my beauty when I want to. And today is not that day.
Do you hear that? It's the sound of a hawk. Or a leaf. Or maybe nothing at all.

instruction: player interacts with sarcastic stone gargoyle
response: Oh, you're looking for advice? Why not ask the pigeons? They know more.
I crow at the dawn! You can't take that from me!
I've traveled many roads, and they all lead to more songs. You want to hear one?
I hunt alone. But for you? I'll make an exception.
I scream because the world can't hear my pain. Maybe you can.
Meow? Are you my mom? Wait, I think I'm lost.
I'll fly circles around you, and you won't even notice!
I don't talk much, but when I do, you should listen.
I see everything, but I'll only share the secrets I find amusing.
Peace is not found in the world. It's found in stillness.
You seek answers? I only offer questions.
I play my tunes for tips. But I'll steal your heart for free.
I've fought my last battle. Now I'm just trying to sleep.
Polly wants a cracker? I want your treasure.
I haven't moved in a hundred years. Maybe today's the day.
I didn't steal that. I borrowed it... for a while.
You can try to chase me, but you won't catch me.

instruction: player interacts with grumpy hermit crab
response: I'm fine in my shell, thank you. Stay out.
I've seen kingdoms rise and fall. I don't care about your petty problems.
You want something rare? I've got just the thing for you.

instruction: player interacts with busy office worker
response: Yeah, I'm in the middle of something. Just make it quick.

instruction: player interacts with coffee shop barista
response: Extra shot? You'll need it if you're working late tonight.
Where to? And if you've got no plan, I'll pick the route.
Just another day at the top. Don't look down too much.
I don't just paint walls. I paint stories.
It's not much, but it's the only way to escape this tunnel.
You think I can make this hat float? Just watch me.
Everything glows here-especially the deals.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing umbrella
response: It's more than rain protection. It's a light in the dark.
Not today. But if you can keep up, I might show you a shortcut.
I clean more than floors. Sometimes, I clean up messes you don't see.
Deadline's pressing. Got a package for you, but I'm already behind.

instruction: player interacts with person with a briefcase
response: This case? Don't worry about it. It's just a *little* more than paperwork.

instruction: player interacts with hot dog vendor
response: Best dogs in the city. Just be sure you're hungry enough.
This trick? It's old, but it'll still make your jaw drop.

instruction: player interacts with barista with a tattoo
response: It's not just art. It's a reminder to keep grinding.

instruction: player interacts with person selling magic shoes
response: These'll get you where you need to go-*fast*.

instruction: player interacts with man with a glowing watch
response: Time isn't just numbers. It's a reminder of what you've missed.
Up here, the city feels a little quieter. You want to stay a while?

instruction: player interacts with food truck vendor
response: You haven't had a taco until you've had *this* taco.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing skateboard
response: Not your typical board, huh? It's faster than it looks.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing necklace
response: Don't ask where I got it. Just know it lights the way when the city gets dark.

instruction: player interacts with office worker with a coffee cup
response: It's not magic, just strong coffee. But it feels like it.

instruction: player interacts with man with a glowing key
response: This? It opens more than doors. You don't want to know what's behind them.

instruction: player interacts with street food cart vendor
response: Best dumplings on the block. They've got a secret ingredient.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing map
response: It shows shortcuts, hidden alleys... things most people miss.

instruction: player interacts with grumpy mountain goat
response: I'm not moving. If you want to pass, you'll have to convince me.
I've got theories and experiments you wouldn't believe! Care for a demonstration?
My songs are all that remain of a life once lived. Would you like to hear my favorite?
Who's there? Ah, it's just you. Didn't expect company at this hour.
I've seen you around before! Stayed in the same room last month, didn't you?
I tend the garden by myself these days. Flowers are better company than people.
I'm always on the move! You should try it sometime. It's *so* much fun!
I've swung a sword for years, but what's it all for? Some things, you can't fight.
Seek answers within, and you'll find them. If you look hard enough.
I could steal your heart, but that would be *too* easy.
Bow before me, mortal! But I'll allow you to speak, for now.
A good harvest is all you need in life, don't you think? Care for a fresh apple?
I've hammered this iron for hours, and it's still not right. I could use a break.

instruction: player interacts with nervous horse trainer
response: I think this horse might be ready for the race‚Ä¶ or maybe not. We'll see.
I've been marching for days. Don't ask me for a fight right now.
Why do you wear armor? Is it heavy? I bet I could wear it!
I have secrets. Want to trade? I'll give you one, for a price.
I sing the songs of the road, though they're often a bit out of tune.
My life is a tragedy! Would you like to hear about my *most* tragic performance?

instruction: player interacts with tired cart driver
response: I've hauled this cart for days. Care to help with the load?
I've been wandering for hours. Do you know where this road leads?
No, we don't have any more rooms! If you want to stay, find somewhere else!
I'm small, but I've got ideas that are *bigger* than anyone's!
The soup's boiling over! What do you want? Quick!
Peace is found in silence, but words have their place, too. What is it you seek?
I've pounded metal for years, but I've never forged something that mattered.
The greatest power lies in knowledge. But you must seek it with a careful mind.
Don't touch anything! I'm just testing this spell‚Ä¶ oops.
The sea's unpredictable. Best be prepared, or it'll swallow you whole.
I'm not moving. Not unless there's food involved.
I paint, but the canvas never captures what I truly see.
Catch of the day! Or maybe it's just the tide playing tricks again.
I can mend your wounds, but I'll need a moment to gather my herbs first.
I can make you fly-well, for a minute, at least. If you're lucky.
I write words that no one will ever read. But they help me understand the world.
Run, run, run! You can't catch me! Bet I'm faster than you!
You didn't see anything, right? Good. Let's keep it that way.
I wander the land to find those in need. It's the only thing that makes sense.
You can keep your fancy rules. I'd rather break them.
Hurry? That's not my style. I'll get there when I get there.
I sing the songs of joy, and my heart is light, despite the world's troubles.
Time is the greatest teacher. But don't waste it, for it's the only thing that slips away.
I'm faster than you, and I know the best escape routes!
Did you hear about Lord Oren? His new armor looks‚Ä¶ questionable, to say the least.
You shouldn't be here. But if you must be, you'd better not tell anyone.
I spend more time with the sea than with people. It's a good way to think.
Oh, your leg's broken? I'm sure it's not the worst injury ever.
I've got a potion for everything! Well, almost everything. Except the weather.
Don't ask me for a song. I'm not in the mood to sing about dragons today.
I have *so* many nuts! And maybe some of your secrets, too!
I'll get there eventually. Just... give me a minute.
I've seen kingdoms rise and fall from above. But I'll land for a moment.
I am the king of this land. But I'll make an exception for you.
Another round? Better hurry, or someone else will take your seat!
I've lived in the shadows long enough to know when to be silent.
I've traveled all over the world. Ask me anything!
I fly fast, and I talk faster. Keep up!
I swear the ingredients were right... now, what was I making again?
I can't talk long. My stomach is making more noise than you.
I'm not stealing. I'm *collecting*... for later.
You don't see many of my kind around here. We're more *quiet*.
Let me tell you a tale... or two. Or maybe three.
I'm not moving. You'll have to do more than just ask.
I've stood here for centuries. And I'll stand for many more.
Catch me if you can! I'm gone before you know it.
Life's a game. Let's play!
The world can wait. I'm hibernating early this year.
I've traveled far and wide, but I've never met anyone quite like you.
I am the most beautiful thing you'll see today. Don't argue.
I can't stay still for long... Something's watching.
The path is long, but it's the journey, not the destination, that matters.
What's so funny? Everything, apparently.
I've got a thousand songs in me. Want to hear one?
Slow and steady wins the race... but I'm already winning.
I am not here to speak, but to observe. Be careful.
I can make you laugh... or make you cry. Today, I'll settle for both.
I'll get there... eventually. Don't rush me.
The river's my playground! Care to join me?
I have my orders, and they're not to converse with strangers.
I've seen things from above that would make your head spin.
The road is long, and I've walked it alone for far too long.
I don't need to chase you. You'll come to me when I'm ready.
I'm not picky. Anything that doesn't run away is fair game.
I'm too small to stand out. Please don't eat me.
I've been watching you for a while. You're interesting.
Did you hear about the latest adventure? Let me tell you everything!
Dreams are the best adventures. Too bad they don't last long.
I've got no time for nonsense. Wake me up when something's important.
I'm not picky... but I'm always hungry.
It's too early for riddles. Come back at midnight.
Want to play a game? If you win, I'll give you a secret.
I don't move unless I absolutely have to.
I haunt these halls, waiting for something... or someone... to remember me.
The answers you seek are in the winds. But they won't speak until you listen.
I'm not here to talk. I'm here for something shiny... or edible.
I've been told I ask too many questions... but I don't care.
Shh! Quiet! The books are listening. Don't make a sound.
You've stepped into my territory. Now, get out.
I know all the gossip. Do you want to know who's dating who?
*twitches nose* I'm not sure about you... but you seem safe, I guess.
What is it now? I'm too busy to deal with your questions.
The road's long, and I've walked it all. You should try it sometime.
I'm not lazy. I'm just... conserving energy. Ever heard of it?
I'm tired of haggling. Take it or leave it.
Who are we, really? *Whoooo* cares?
I can make you laugh or make you mad-your choice!
I don't trust you... yet. Keep your hands where I can see them.
No, I'm *not* lost. The map just doesn't make sense!
Look! I made this! Do you think it's good?
A coin? A meal? I haven't seen either in days...
You won't find better ale than here! Want some?
I've slain beasts and earned titles. What have you done?
The forest speaks, but only to those who listen... and sometimes to me.
No time for pleasantries. I'm studying the obscure.
I didn't break it! I promise!
Ah, a listener! My songs are worth a thousand stories!
Time passes, and with it, everything changes. Including me.
*slime trail* Hurry? Ha! I move at my own pace.
Silence is the path to understanding. Can you hear it?
*sniff sniff* I smell food... you wouldn't happen to have some?
The ocean's so big, and I'm so small. But I still sing its stories!
No, you can't borrow that book. It's too precious.
Catch me if you can! Bet you can't!
It's so dark! Why is it always dark?
*yawns* This tree's the best napping spot. Go away.

instruction: player interacts with reflective water nymph
response: I reflect everything... but nothing is truly seen, is it?
*crow* It's a new day! Time to rise, and shine, and... oh wait, it's too early.
I've hoarded too many riches. I don't know what to do with them all...
*cocks head* You want advice? Well, I guess I'll share.
*glows* I'm not used to visitors... but I don't mind you being here.
If you're looking for a fight, you'll find one. But I warn you, I'm not in the mood.
I've wandered too long... maybe you can lead me somewhere new.
You're too slow! Catch me if you can!
The sheep don't talk much. I'm okay with that.
I see you, tiny one. Hope you're not afraid of heights.
What's yours is mine... and what's mine is definitely still mine.
I soar high above, but you? You're grounded.
You want bread, or do you want to hear my life story?
I'm not sure I'm ready... but I must try, for honor.

instruction: player interacts with energetic wolf pup
response: Playtime! Let's run and jump and *zoom*!

instruction: player interacts with wise old man
response: Wisdom comes from living long, but you can learn a lot from the young.
*chirp chirp* You never know where I'll land next.
I've seen too many hunters. Please don't be one.
The sky is always gray. Is that not enough of an omen?
Where was I going again? Ah, who cares. What do you need?
*bubbles* Careful where you swim, stranger. It's a big pond.
I dig in the dark. Maybe I can help you find something you're searching for.
I've been running for days. Can you carry me for a while?
I circle the sky, waiting for things to end. Or begin.
*twitches nose* Don't get too close... you might scare me.
I can make flowers grow with a wink... or make them disappear. Wanna see?
Healing doesn't come from potions alone. It comes from care.
I am but a fleeting moment of light. Enjoy me while you can.
*sniffs the air* Are you... a friend?
I don't want to talk. But I will, if you have food.
I've got all the secrets, but I'm not telling. Not yet.
I don't share my meals. Not even with friends.
*flutters nervously* The wind's not kind today.
I've got acorns! You want one? Or ten?
I'm not going anywhere, unless you need me to. Then, I'm all in.
I see what you don't. And I keep it to myself, mostly.
The fire's warm, the drinks are cold, and the gossip's spicy!
I'll trade you this shiny thing for some of that food.
I've stood here for centuries. A few more moments won't matter.
I don't move much. But I've seen it all.
You want a weapon? I'll forge it. But don't blame me when it breaks.
I've been lost so long, I don't remember where I came from.
Time is an illusion. But you'll learn that eventually.
I'm not hungry... yet. But keep your distance, just in case.
I've walked roads you've never heard of. Maybe I'll tell you about them.
Songs? I've sung enough for a lifetime. But I'll sing another, if you insist.
I've been here longer than anyone. I don't move.
Don't step too close. My web is perfect.
I don't run races anymore. My legs are tired.
Look at all the shiny things I've found! Want to trade?
Time is money. And I've got plenty of both.
Just five more minutes... I'll be up after the next dream.
You didn't hear this from me, but I've got something special in my bag.
Life's a joke, and I'm the punchline. Want to hear one?
The sea's unpredictable. So am I. Don't trust either of us.
I'll light your way. But not for long. Keep up!
I can mend your wounds. But can I heal your heart?
I've seen too many things. I keep them to myself.
Duty calls. It always does. I've learned to answer it.
*scurries away* I'm busy. Go talk to someone else.
I'm not real, but I'm always near.
Squawk! What's that you say? I know all the gossip!
I drift through the sky, seeing things you'll never know.
I dig. Fast. You better keep up.
*flicks ears nervously* Are you going to hurt me?
I rule this land, and I don't share my throne.
I can climb to the highest branch. Can you?
I've seen the depths you've never explored. You'd drown down here.
I'm not angry. I'm just hungry. Don't make me show you.
I've roamed these woods longer than you've walked this earth.

instruction: player interacts with wise old owl
response: I know the forest like the back of my wing. Follow me, if you dare.
I'm not moving unless you've got something good for me.
I don't need words. My fists speak louder.
I may be small, but my tricks are bigger than you think!
You're food. Or, at least, you would be if I wasn't so picky.
I'll get up in a minute. Maybe. Or maybe I won't.
I flicker in and out of sight. Can you catch me?
I've lost my way. Care to help me find it?
Don't get too close. I burn when I'm bothered.
I didn't steal your heart. I borrowed it. Forever.

instruction: player interacts with street vendor selling sunglasses
response: These will block the sun-and maybe something else if you wear them long enough.

instruction: player interacts with busy office worker at a desk
response: Another report to finish. I'll take a break when the clock stops.

instruction: player interacts with hot dog vendor with a secret recipe
response: One bite and you'll be hooked. Don't ask for the recipe.

instruction: player interacts with taxi driver with a map
response: This is the fastest way, but I can show you the scenic route if you're in the mood.

instruction: player interacts with lever at the back of an alley
response: You pull it, and the streetlight flickers. Something's behind that wall.

instruction: player interacts with bike messenger in a hurry
response: Got a delivery, don't have time for small talk. Catch me if you can!

instruction: player interacts with subway musician playing a beat
response: The rhythm's hypnotic. You feel like you're moving even when you're standing still.

instruction: player interacts with glowing lever in a forgotten building
response: When you pull it, the floor trembles. Maybe something secret is about to open.

instruction: player interacts with food truck vendor in the rain
response: Hot soup, cold weather-perfect match. Don't mind the drizzle.

instruction: player interacts with person holding a glowing coffee cup
response: This one's different-tastes like dreams and determination.

instruction: player interacts with lever by an abandoned elevator
response: The button doesn't work. But this lever? Who knows what's below.

instruction: player interacts with street performer juggling flaming pins
response: You think I'm good with fire? Wait 'til you see what else I can juggle.

instruction: player interacts with old man with a glowing pocket watch
response: This thing? It never ticks the same twice. Time's funny like that.

instruction: player interacts with construction worker at a site
response: You need something lifted? I'm your guy. Just don't ask me about the sky.

instruction: player interacts with person with a glowing pen
response: This pen writes futures. Sometimes, it writes its own.
